title.value: Plan-based Prompting Improves Literature Review Generation
title.justification: This value is directly obtained from the title of the research paper under review.
title.quote: Plan-based Prompting Improves Literature Review Generation

extractions.description: This paper explores the capability of large language models (LLMs) in generating literature reviews for scientific research papers, particularly focusing on a novel strategy of creating an intermediate plan before generating the actual text. The study demonstrates that this intermediate planning step improves the quality of the literature reviews generated by LLMs compared to vanilla zero-shot generation. Additionally, the authors introduce a new corpus consisting of recent arXiv papers and extend the existing Multi-XScience dataset to include full-text research papers rather than just abstracts.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments to evaluate the effectiveness of plan-based prompting in literature review generation using empirical data from various datasets.
type.quote: our empirical study shows that these intermediate plans improve the quality of generated literature reviews over vanilla zero-shot generation
